title: Miranda 10th anniversary: Everything that's making it such 'fun'
text:
Miranda is celebrating 10 years of slapstick gold (Picture: BBC)

Miranda Hart is officially making a comeback (well, a one-off comeback) to celebrate the 10-year anniversary of her much-loved sitcom.

Get your hairdryers ready for the biscuit blizzard and invite round all your fruit friends – it’s going to be a good one.

If you want to join in the fun in person though, you can, with the one-hour special being filmed at the London Palladium before airing on BBC One at the end of this year.

Speaking about the upcoming event, Miranda Hart said: ‘What happened with my sitcom and comedy alter-ego over the last ten years has been unexpected to say the least, so it’s very moving for me to have the chance to celebrate and thank my cast and the fans from The Palladium stage.

‘We are hoping to put together a what-I-call such fun hour of television for them all.’

The BBC added that there’ll be a lot of ‘silliness, dancing and enforced galloping’ so pretty much, everything we’ve been missing from the series since it ended in 2015.

Miranda had previously teased that some special guests might be appearing alongside her when the series was first announced in July.

But there’s no shortage of famous pals who could drop by.

Patricia Hodge took on the role of Miranda’s overbearing but loving mother, Penny, with Sarah Hadland playing her bestie Stevie, and Sally Phillips was her ever busy and snooty friend, Tilly.

Then of course there’s Miranda’s on-screen love (and hubby!) Gary – aka Tom Ellis – but seeing as he’s currently filming season 5 of Lucifer, it might be a little tricky for him to stop by.

Maybe some devillish magic will whisk him back from LA to London for the evening?

Can’t wait to find out. We’ll be here practicing our silly walks while we wait.

Miranda: My Such Fun Celebration will air later this year on BBC One.
